Home.title: New Collection
Home.content: This is the home page content in English.

aboutUs.title: About Us
aboutUs.companyText: It is a combination of style, innovation, and a responsible attitude toward nature. We create eco-friendly clothing using natural and recycled materials, prioritizing comfort, durability, and minimal environmental impact.
aboutUs.missionText: To prove that fashion can be stylish, high-quality, and environmentally responsible. By choosing our clothing, you not only look great but also take a step toward protecting nature.
aboutUs.sustainabilityPrinciples: Our production is based on the principles of sustainable development:
aboutUs.ecoMaterialsText: Organic cotton, linen, hemp, recycled polyester, and other certified fabrics.
aboutUs.ethicalProductionText: We support fair labor by partnering with factories that uphold ethical standards.
aboutUs.zeroWasteText: We strive to minimize waste and use environmentally friendly dyes.

aboutBrand.brandIntro: is a brand that combines environmental responsibility, modern design and technological innovation. We create clothes for residents of megacities who value style, comfort and conscious choice. We strive to make fashion more responsible without sacrificing comfort and self-expression.
aboutBrand.brandStyle: is the style of the future, where trends harmonize with care for the planet.

step1.title: Selection of ecological materials
step1.item3: Recycled materials (polyester from plastic bottles, recycled wool).

step2.title: Ecological dyeing and fabric processing
step2.item1: Use of natural or low-toxicity dyes.
step2.item2: Minimization of water and energy use in the processing.

step3.title: Ethical production
step3.item2: Rejection of child and forced labor.
step3.item3: Control of emissions and production waste.

step4.title: Design and clothing creation
step4.item2: Use of cutting technologies that reduce waste.
step4.item3: Universal designs that extend the product's life cycle.

step5.title: Packaging and logistics
step5.item2: Transportation optimization to reduce CO₂ emissions.

step6.title: Sales and consumption
step6.item1: Transparency in production (labeling of ecological certificates).
step6.item2: Educational campaigns for consumers on proper clothing care.

step7.title: Recycling and reuse
step7.item1: Collection of old clothes for secondary use or recycling.
step7.item2: Development of upcycling programs (creating new products from old materials).

1. Sorting and assessment
2. Repair and refurbishment

linenDenim.name: Linen Denim
linenDenim.desc: A blend of linen and cotton for added lightness and breathability.

recycledCotton.name: Recycled Cotton
recycledCotton.desc: Obtained from old fabrics or production scraps, transformed into new yarn.

bambooFabric.name: Bamboo Fabric
bambooFabric.desc: Made from bamboo fibers, sometimes with added organic cotton.

linen.name: Linen
linen.desc: Natural fabric made from linen fibers, requiring minimal water and chemicals.

recycledViscoseTextile.name: Recycled Viscose Textile
recycledViscoseTextile.desc: Made from viscose waste, reducing textile waste.

organicDenim.name: Organic Denim
organicDenim.desc: Made from cotton grown without pesticides and chemicals.

stretchDenim.name: Stretch Denim
stretchDenim.desc: Jeans often contain elastane. Eco-friendly versions use biodegradable elastane.

recycledDenim.name: Recycled Denim
recycledDenim.desc: Obtained from old jeans or production scraps.

hempFabric.name: Hemp Fabric
hempFabric.desc: Very durable natural fabric, resistant to wear and tear.

waxedCotton.name: Waxed Cotton
waxedCotton.desc: Cotton treated with wax for water resistance.

bioplastic.name: Bioplastic
bioplastic.desc: Used for accessories. Made from corn starch or castor oil, allowing it to decompose naturally.

bamboo.name: Bamboo
bamboo.desc: Environmentally friendly, rapidly renewable material. Requires no chemical fertilizers or pesticides.

recycledPlastic.name: Recycled Plastic
recycledPlastic.desc: Often made from collected ocean waste or plastic bottles. Using such material helps reduce plastic pollution.

glass.name: Glass
glass.desc: Environmentally friendly, rapidly renewable material. Requires no chemical fertilizers or pesticides.

ReturnClothes.howToReturnTitle: How to return clothes for recycling
ReturnClothes.description2: are committed to a sustainable future, and you can be part of this movement! If you have old items from our brand that you no longer wear, we offer a convenient and eco-friendly way to recycle them.
ReturnClothes.step1: Check the condition – make sure the clothes are clean and dry. We accept items with minor defects, but heavily damaged or soiled items should be disposed of in another way.
ReturnClothes.step2: Pack the items – place the clothes in any clean packaging (bag or box).
ReturnClothes.method1: Bring to our brand store – find the nearest drop-off point on the map https://www.google.com/maps/place/%D0%A3%D0%BA%.
ReturnClothes.method2: Send by courier – arrange a return through a courier service, specifying our address.
ReturnClothes.method3: Get a bonus – for participating in the recycling program we give you a discount or bonus points for your next purchase. More about the promotion: https://urban-fusion-5fee.vercel.app/en
ReturnClothes.afterReturnTitle: What happens to clothes after return?
ReturnClothes.after1: Collected items are sent for recycling, where they get a second life. Materials are reused for fabrics, insulation, or other useful materials, reducing environmental impact.
ReturnClothes.after2: Join us in creating a more eco-friendly future! If you have any questions, contact us via email at project21022025@proton.me.

Recycling.title: Clothing Recycling
Recycling.description: is the process of turning old or unwanted clothes into new items of added value. It’s an eco-friendly approach that helps reduce textile waste and create unique products.

01.title: Sorting and evaluation
list: The condition of clothing is checked: what can be restored, and what should be broken down into materials.
Items that can be resold as second-hand or suitable for recycling are identified.

02.title: Repair and refresh
list: Dyeing or bleaching fabric to change its appearance.
Adding patches, prints, embroidery, or other decorations.

03.title: Remake and modification
list: Changing the style: turning t-shirts into crop tops, jeans into shorts, or denim into bags.
Combining fabrics to create new designs.
Using leftover fabric for accessories (headbands, covers, wallets).

04.title: Material breakdown
list: Unrepairable clothes are cut into pieces for further use.
Creating new yarn from old sweaters.
Transforming textiles into rags, insulation, or even new fabrics.

05.title: Factory recycling
list: Some companies specialize in industrial recycling: shredding fabric and converting it into new raw materials for clothing, carpets, or insulation.
Clothing recycling extends the life of garments and helps reduce the environmental footprint of textile production.
